page.title: 03COASTAL BIRDLIFE III
page.content: Many seabirds can be observed {offshore}from Prestatyn though they are very often far out. Gannets, Guillemots, Razorbills,Cormorants, Kittiwakes,fulmars and the Gulls can be seen at all times of the year though their numbers do vary with season and weather. (A few pairs of fulmar nest sometimes at a disused quarry.)In Summer terns can be seen as well as Manx Shearwaters. Autumn is one the best times for seeing seabirds, especially during gales from between West and North, Arctic skuas,Bonxies and Leach's Petrels can be seen.(Prestatyn is one of the best spots in the country for seeing the fairly rare Leach's Petrel.)In winter Red-Throated Divers and Great Crested Grebes occur and at most seasons Shelducks,Common scoter and Red_Breasted_Merganser can be seen.
